intro: Andinopuntia floccosa subsp. yanganucensis, commonly known as the Yanganucensis Paddle Cactus, is a unique cactus species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems that are often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to rocky soils and high altitudes. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
